headline: Fda Approves Pfizer Booster Shots People Over 65 Or High Risk
summary: On Wednesday, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved a third shot of the Pfizer and BioNTech coronavirus vaccine for individuals ages 65 and older, and those who are at high risk or have high-risk jobs (such as health care workers and teachers).  The CDC estimates that about 53 million Americans are aged 65 and older, and another 20 million are health care workers, and up to 100 million people have medical conditions that put them at increased risk.  The FDA approval clears the way for fast distribution of the shots, which would be administered six months after the second dose.Last week, an advisory panel to the FDArejected approval of the booster shot for other individuals, saying there was not enough evidence to support the authorization.
